translated: In the milk of a young maiden,

original: sngags kyi phreng ba bzlas shing bdar //

translated: Recite and churn the mantra garland.

original: gzhan dang ldan pa mig la byugs //

original: tha mar rmi lam brtags la nyal //
analyzed: tha mar rmi lam brtags la nyal //
translated: In the end, examine the dreams and go to sleep.

original: me long lag tu thogs pa dang // tshes gcig zla ba mthong ba dang // shing rta'i 'khor lo zhon pa dang // gos dkar rgyan dkar gyon pa dang // glang po lcags kyus 'dul ba dang // snying rjes ded dpon byed pa'o //

translated: Holding a mirror in one's hand, seeing the moon on the first day, riding in a chariot, wearing white clothes and ornaments, subduing an elephant with a hook, and acting as a compassionate caravan leader.

original: rmi lam na ni gser rnyed dang ; / rang bzhin khrus la 'jug pa dang // bum pa spyi gtsug bzhag pa dang // gling bzhan kun la dbang skyur dang // rta zhon nor bu'i glong 'gro dang // mi yi khyogs kyis 'degs pa'o //

translated: In a dream, finding gold, naturally entering a bath, placing a vase on one's crown, ruling over all the four continents, riding a horse and going to a jewel island, and being carried in a human palanquin.

original: me tog padmo thu ba dang // glegs bam lag na thogs pa dang / dung la sogs pa 'bud pa dang // me tog phreng pa 'dogs pa dang // rma bya rnyi yis 'dzin pa dang // snying rjes padma chos 'chang ba'o //

translated: Holding a handful of lotus flowers, holding a scripture in one's hand, blowing a conch and so forth, wearing a flower garland, catching a peacock with a snare, and compassionately upholding the Dharma of the lotus.

original: mtshon thogs g-yul las rgyal ba dang // rgyal po 'khor du gyur pa dang // dmag mi g-yul du bskor ba dang // zhi ba'i las la 'god pa dang // bya shar te ru po nyar gtong //
analyzed: mtshon thogs g-yul las rgyal ba dang // rgyal po 'khor du gyur pa dang // dmag mi g-yul du bskor ba dang // zhi ba'i las la 'god pa dang // bya shar te ru po nyar gtong //
translated: sending out birds and beasts.

original: nags tshal me yis bsregs pa'o //
analyzed: nags tshal me yis bsregs pa'o //
translated: The forest being burned by fire.🔽Swimming without sinking in water,

original: chu la mi nub rkyal ba dang // nam mkha' la yang 'gro zhing lding //
analyzed: chu la mi nub rkyal ba dang // nam mkha' la yang 'gro zhing lding //
translated: and moving and flying in the sky.🔽Wearing the sun and moon as ornaments,🔽sitting on a lion throne,

original: nyi zla rgyan du gon pa dang // seng ge khri stan gnon pa dang // gdugs dkar phub cing rgyal mtshan bsgreng //
analyzed: nyi zla rgyan du gon pa dang // seng ge khri stan gnon pa dang // gdugs dkar phub cing rgyal mtshan bsgreng //
translated: erecting a white parasol and hoisting a victory banner,

original: kun gyis mchod pa'i 'os 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kun gyis mchod pa'i 'os 'gyur ba'o //
translated: becoming worthy of everyone's worship.🔽Draining blood and lymph,🔽subduing a mass of fire without fear,🔽eating snakes and scorpions,🔽holding a vajra and bell,

original: khrag dang chu ser zag pa dang / me dpung rdzi zhing mi 'jigs dang // sprul dang sdig pa za ba dang // rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa dang // ri bo rtse la gnon pa dang // grong khyer mdzub mos skyor ba'o //

translated: pressing down on mountain peaks,🔽pointing with the index finger at a city.

original: bla ma yi dam mchod pa dang // glegs bam 'dri zhing mchod rten brtsig / gcer bur byung glu gar byed dang // dge slong tshogs dang lhan cig 'grogs //
analyzed: bla ma yi dam mchod pa dang // glegs bam 'dri zhing mchod rten brtsig / gcer bur byung glu gar byed dang // dge slong tshogs dang lhan cig 'grogs //
translated: and associating with a group of monks.

original: gos @130b bzang gyon zhing shing 'bru za //
analyzed: gos @130b bzang gyon zhing shing 'bru za //
translated: Wearing good clothes, and eating grain.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya ste //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya ste //
translated: These are the mudras of the Tathagata.

original: shis pa brjod cing lung ston byed //
analyzed: shis pa brjod cing lung ston byed //
translated: They are auspicious, and they give predictions.🔽A great swirling pool of water,🔽building a high house,

original: chu yi rdzing chen 'khyil ba dang // gnas khang mthon po brtsig pa dang // yid dang mthun par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chu yi rdzing chen 'khyil ba dang // gnas khang mthon po brtsig pa dang // yid dang mthun par 'byung ba'o //
translated: and things happening in accordance with one's wishes.🔽Being separated from one's ornaments by enemies,🔽being sick and grieving,🔽being put in prison,🔽having one's wealth stolen and being put in chains,

original: dgra yis rgyan dang bral ba dang // na chud mya ngan byed pa dang // khri mon nang du bcug pa dang // nor phrogs lcags su bcug pa dang // 'gro ba ngan pas rdzi ba dang // gcan gzan lus la 'phyang ba dang // srang bus dkris shing dri mas g-yogs //
analyzed: dgra yis rgyan dang bral ba dang // na chud mya ngan byed pa dang // khri mon nang du bcug pa dang // nor phrogs lcags su bcug pa dang // 'gro ba ngan pas rdzi ba dang // gcan gzan lus la 'phyang ba dang // srang bus dkris shing dri mas g-yogs //
translated: being oppressed by bad people,🔽having one's body hung from a tree,🔽being wrapped in a blanket and covered with dirt,

original: dri ma za zhing dri ma 'thungs //
analyzed: dri ma za zhing dri ma 'thungs //
translated: eating dirt, and drinking dirt.

original: bla ma slob dpon grogs po dang // pha ma rnams ni mthong nas 'bros //
analyzed: bla ma slob dpon grogs po dang // pha ma rnams ni mthong nas 'bros //
translated: Seeing the guru, the master, the friend, the father, the mother, they flee.

original: shin tu gcong rong mi med dang ; / yang na 'brog dgon la sogs par //
analyzed: shin tu gcong rong mi med dang ; / yang na 'brog dgon la sogs par //
translated: In a very deep ravine, in a deserted place, or in a forest,

original: zas dang skom gyis nyam thag ste //
analyzed: zas dang skom gyis nyam thag ste //
translated: they are tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: kyi hud bdag sdug zer gyi g-ya' //
analyzed: kyi hud bdag sdug zer gyi g-ya' //
translated: “Alas! I am suffering!” they cry out.

original: go cha bshus nas mtshon gyis 'debs //
analyzed: go cha bshus nas mtshon gyis 'debs //
translated: They take off their armor and are struck down by weapons.

original: nags kyi dkyil na phyin nas kyang //
analyzed: nags kyi dkyil na phyin nas kyang //
translated: Having gone into the middle of the forest,

original: stag dang ce sbyang dud 'gro 'debs //
analyzed: stag dang ce sbyang dud 'gro 'debs //
translated: they are attacked by tigers, hyenas, and wild beasts.

original: de sogs yid gdung bar 'byung ba //
analyzed: de sogs yid gdung bar 'byung ba //
translated: Such things happen, causing mental anguish.

original: dge dang mi dge'i ltas su rigs //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge'i ltas su rigs //
translated: They should be known as the signs of virtue and nonvirtue.🔽Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, Akṣobhya, and Vajrasattva are the six families,

original: rnam par snang mdzad rin chen 'byung ldan dang // 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa dang // mi bskyod pa dang rdo rje sems rigs drug / go rims nyid dang sna tshogs 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad rin chen 'byung ldan dang // 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa dang // mi bskyod pa dang rdo rje sems rigs drug / go rims nyid dang sna tshogs 'dres pa'o //
translated: in their own order, and mixed.

original: shis pa'i rmi lam la ni sgrub pa tsam //
analyzed: shis pa'i rmi lam la ni sgrub pa tsam //
translated: In the case of auspicious dreams, there is just the practice.

original: rin chen phyag rgyar bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: rin chen phyag rgyar bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin //
translated: As explained in the ritual of the precious seal,

original: mi dge'i ltas la til gyi spyin sreg bya //
analyzed: mi dge'i ltas la til gyi spyin sreg bya //
translated: one should perform a sesame fire offering for inauspicious signs.

original: rigs de zhig la stong gis sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de zhig la stong gis sbyangs pa'o //
translated: The family is purified by a thousand [recitations].

original: bag chags yi dags yid brid pa //
analyzed: bag chags yi dags yid brid pa //
translated: The habitual tendencies are the deception of the mind.

original: 'khor ba'i chos kun rmi lam bzhin //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos kun rmi lam bzhin //
translated: All the phenomena of samsara are like a dream.

original: rnal 'byor pa yis blta bar bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis blta bar bya //
translated: The yogi should look at them.

original: 'khrul pa yang dag min phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang dag min phyir ro //
translated: Because delusion is not real.

original: bzang po rtogs las ye shes skye //
analyzed: bzang po rtogs las ye shes skye //
translated: Wisdom arises from realizing the good.

original: blos brtags don ni skye ba med //
analyzed: blos brtags don ni skye ba med //
translated: The object designated by the mind is unborn.

original: de phyir gsang sngags rten 'byung gi / thabs la rag las gtso bor gzung //
analyzed: de phyir gsang sngags rten 'byung gi / thabs la rag las gtso bor gzung //
translated: Therefore, the mantra is primarily dependent on the method of dependent origination.

original: byang chub sems bskyed pa dang dbang bskur ba'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems bskyed pa dang dbang bskur ba'i //
translated: The explanation of the dream of generating bodhicitta and empowerment

original: rmi lam bstan pa klu sgrub gzhung las btus //
analyzed: rmi lam bstan pa klu sgrub gzhung las btus //
translated: is extracted from Nāgārjuna's text.

original: legs dang nyes pa'i rim pa gsal byed pas //
analyzed: legs dang nyes pa'i rim pa gsal byed pas //
translated: By clarifying the stages of good and bad,🔽may one see the face of Mañjuśrījñānasattva.

analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i zhal mthong shog / rmi lam brtag pa //
translated: The Examination of Dreams🔽is complete.

analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dpal ldan gnyis su med pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: It was composed by the Indian master Śrī Advaya Avadhūti.
